name: Auto-generated JSON TDLib API for Pytdbot ~ https://github.com/pytdbot/client

classes.MaskPoint: Part of the face, relative to which a mask is placed

classes.PageBlockVerticalAlignment: Describes a Vertical alignment of a table cell content

classes.InputPassportElementErrorSource: Contains the description of an error in a Telegram Passport element; for bots only
classes.MessageContent: Contains the content of a message

classes.InputMessageContent: The content of a message to send
classes.SearchMessagesFilter: Represents a filter for message search results
classes.ChatAction: Describes the different types of activity in a chat

classes.CallDiscardReason: Describes the reason why a call was discarded

classes.InputInlineQueryResult: Represents a single result of an inline query; for bots only
classes.InlineQueryResult: Represents a single result of an inline query

classes.BackgroundFill: Describes a fill of a background

error.description: An object of this type can be returned on every function call, in case of an error

code.description: Error code; subject to future changes. If the error code is 406, the error message must not be processed in any way and must not be displayed to the user

message.description: Error message; subject to future changes

ok.description: An object of this type is returned on a successful function call for certain functions

authenticationCodeTypeTelegramMessage.description: An authentication code is delivered via a private Telegram message, which can be viewed from another active session

authenticationCodeTypeSms.description: An authentication code is delivered via an SMS message to the specified phone number; applications may not receive this type of code

authenticationCodeTypeCall.description: An authentication code is delivered via a phone call to the specified phone number

authenticationCodeTypeFlashCall.description: An authentication code is delivered by an immediately canceled call to the specified phone number. The phone number that calls is the code that must be entered automatically

pattern.description: Pattern of the phone number from which the call will be made

authenticationCodeTypeMissedCall.description: An authentication code is delivered by an immediately canceled call to the specified phone number. The last digits of the phone number that calls are the code that must be entered manually by the user

phone_number_prefix.description: Prefix of the phone number from which the call will be made

length.description: Number of digits in the code, excluding the prefix

authenticationCodeTypeFragment.description: An authentication code is delivered to https://fragment.com. The user must be logged in there via a wallet owning the phone number's NFT

url.description: URL to open to receive the code

authenticationCodeTypeFirebaseAndroid.description: An authentication code is delivered via Firebase Authentication to the official Android application

nonce.description: Nonce to pass to the SafetyNet Attestation API

authenticationCodeTypeFirebaseIos.description: An authentication code is delivered via Firebase Authentication to the official iOS application

receipt.description: Receipt of successful application token validation to compare with receipt from push notification

push_timeout.description: Time after the next authentication method is supposed to be used if verification push notification isn't received, in seconds

authenticationCodeInfo.description: Information about the authentication code that was sent

phone_number.description: A phone number that is being authenticated

type.description: The way the code was sent to the user

next_type.description: The way the next code will be sent to the user; may be null

timeout.description: Timeout before the code can be re-sent, in seconds

emailAddressAuthenticationCodeInfo.description: Information about the email address authentication code that was sent

email_address_pattern.description: Pattern of the email address to which an authentication code was sent

length.description: Length of the code; 0 if unknown

emailAddressAuthenticationCode.description: An authentication code delivered to a user's email address

emailAddressAuthenticationAppleId.description: An authentication token received through Apple ID

emailAddressAuthenticationGoogleId.description: An authentication token received through Google ID

emailAddressResetStateAvailable.description: Email address can be reset after the given period. Call resetAuthenticationEmailAddress to reset it and allow the user to authorize with a code sent to the user's phone number

wait_period.description: Time required to wait before the email address can be reset; 0 if the user is subscribed to Telegram Premium

emailAddressResetStatePending.description: Email address reset has already been requested. Call resetAuthenticationEmailAddress to check whether immediate reset is possible

reset_in.description: Left time before the email address will be reset, in seconds. updateAuthorizationState is not sent when this field changes

textEntity.description: Represents a part of the text that needs to be formatted in some unusual way

offset.description: Offset of the entity, in UTF-16 code units

length.description: Length of the entity, in UTF-16 code units

textEntities.description: Contains a list of text entities

entities.description: Entities contained in the text. Entities can be nested, but must not mutually intersect with each other. Pre, Code and PreCode entities can't contain other entities. Bold, Italic, Underline, Strikethrough, and Spoiler entities can contain and can be part of any other entities. All other entities can't contain each other

text.description: Text of the terms of service

min_user_age.description: The minimum age of a user to be able to accept the terms; 0 if age isn't restricted

show_popup.description: True, if a blocking popup with terms of service must be shown to the user

authorizationStateWaitTdlibParameters.description: Initialization parameters are needed. Call setTdlibParameters to provide them

authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber.description: TDLib needs the user's phone number to authorize. Call setAuthenticationPhoneNumber to provide the phone number, or use requestQrCodeAuthentication or checkAuthenticationBotToken for other authentication options

authorizationStateWaitEmailAddress.description: TDLib needs the user's email address to authorize. Call setAuthenticationEmailAddress to provide the email address, or directly call checkAuthenticationEmailCode with Apple ID/Google ID token if allowed

allow_apple_id.description: True, if authorization through Apple ID is allowed

allow_google_id.description: True, if authorization through Google ID is allowed

authorizationStateWaitEmailCode.description: TDLib needs the user's authentication code sent to an email address to authorize. Call checkAuthenticationEmailCode to provide the code

allow_apple_id.description: True, if authorization through Apple ID is allowed

allow_google_id.description: True, if authorization through Google ID is allowed

code_info.description: Information about the sent authentication code

email_address_reset_state.description: Reset state of the email address; may be null if the email address can't be reset

authorizationStateWaitCode.description: TDLib needs the user's authentication code to authorize. Call checkAuthenticationCode to check the code

code_info.description: Information about the authorization code that was sent

authorizationStateWaitOtherDeviceConfirm.description: The user needs to confirm authorization on another logged in device by scanning a QR code with the provided link

link.description: A tg:// URL for the QR code. The link will be updated frequently

authorizationStateWaitRegistration.description: The user is unregistered and need to accept terms of service and enter their first name and last name to finish registration. Call registerUser to accept the terms of service and provide the data

authorizationStateWaitPassword.description: The user has been authorized, but needs to enter a 2-step verification password to start using the application. Call checkAuthenticationPassword to provide the password, or requestAuthenticationPasswordRecovery to recover the password, or deleteAccount to delete the account after a week

password_hint.description: Hint for the password; may be empty

has_recovery_email_address.description: True, if a recovery email address has been set up

has_passport_data.description: True, if some Telegram Passport elements were saved

recovery_email_address_pattern.description: Pattern of the email address to which the recovery email was sent; empty until a recovery email has been sent

authorizationStateReady.description: The user has been successfully authorized. TDLib is now ready to answer general requests

authorizationStateLoggingOut.description: The user is currently logging out

authorizationStateClosing.description: TDLib is closing, all subsequent queries will be answered with the error 500. Note that closing TDLib can take a while. All resources will be freed only after authorizationStateClosed has been received

authorizationStateClosed.description: TDLib client is in its final state. All databases are closed and all resources are released. No other updates will be received after this. All queries will be responded to with error code 500. To continue working, one must create a new instance of the TDLib client

passwordState.description: Represents the current state of 2-step verification

has_password.description: True, if a 2-step verification password is set

password_hint.description: Hint for the password; may be empty

has_recovery_email_address.description: True, if a recovery email is set

has_passport_data.description: True, if some Telegram Passport elements were saved

recovery_email_address_code_info.description: Information about the recovery email address to which the confirmation email was sent; may be null

login_email_address_pattern.description: Pattern of the email address set up for logging in

pending_reset_date.description: If not 0, point in time (Unix timestamp) after which the 2-step verification password can be reset immediately using resetPassword

recoveryEmailAddress.description: Contains information about the current recovery email address

temporaryPasswordState.description: Returns information about the availability of a temporary password, which can be used for payments

has_password.description: True, if a temporary password is available

valid_for.description: Time left before the temporary password expires, in seconds

path.description: Local path to the locally available file part; may be empty

can_be_downloaded.description: True, if it is possible to download or generate the file

can_be_deleted.description: True, if the file can be deleted

is_downloading_active.description: True, if the file is currently being downloaded (or a local copy is being generated by some other means)

is_downloading_completed.description: True, if the local copy is fully available

download_offset.description: Download will be started from this offset. downloaded_prefix_size is calculated from this offset

downloaded_prefix_size.description: If is_downloading_completed is false, then only some prefix of the file starting from download_offset is ready to be read. downloaded_prefix_size is the size of that prefix in bytes

downloaded_size.description: Total downloaded file size, in bytes. Can be used only for calculating download progress. The actual file size may be bigger, and some parts of it may contain garbage

id.description: Remote file identifier; may be empty. Can be used by the current user across application restarts or even from other devices. Uniquely identifies a file, but a file can have a lot of different valid identifiers. If the ID starts with "http://" or "https://", it represents the HTTP URL of the file. TDLib is currently unable to download files if only their URL is known. If downloadFile/addFileToDownloads is called on such a file or if it is sent to a secret chat, TDLib starts a file generation process by sending updateFileGenerationStart to the application with the HTTP URL in the original_path and "#url#" as the conversion string. Application must generate the file by downloading it to the specified location

unique_id.description: Unique file identifier; may be empty if unknown. The unique file identifier which is the same for the same file even for different users and is persistent over time

is_uploading_active.description: True, if the file is currently being uploaded (or a remote copy is being generated by some other means)

is_uploading_completed.description: True, if a remote copy is fully available

uploaded_size.description: Size of the remote available part of the file, in bytes; 0 if unknown

size.description: File size, in bytes; 0 if unknown

expected_size.description: Approximate file size in bytes in case the exact file size is unknown. Can be used to show download/upload progress

local.description: Information about the local copy of the file

remote.description: Information about the remote copy of the file

inputFileId.description: A file defined by its unique ID

inputFileRemote.description: A file defined by its remote ID. The remote ID is guaranteed to be usable only if the corresponding file is still accessible to the user and known to TDLib. For example, if the file is from a message, then the message must be not deleted and accessible to the user. If the file database is disabled, then the corresponding object with the file must be preloaded by the application

inputFileLocal.description: A file defined by a local path

inputFileGenerated.description: A file generated by the application

original_path.description: Local path to a file from which the file is generated; may be empty if there is no such file

conversion.description: String specifying the conversion applied to the original file; must be persistent across application restarts. Conversions beginning with '#' are reserved for internal TDLib usage

expected_size.description: Expected size of the generated file, in bytes; 0 if unknown

photoSize.description: Describes an image in JPEG format

progressive_sizes.description: Sizes of progressive JPEG file prefixes, which can be used to preliminarily show the image; in bytes

minithumbnail.description: Thumbnail image of a very poor quality and low resolution

thumbnailFormatJpeg.description: The thumbnail is in JPEG format

thumbnailFormatGif.description: The thumbnail is in static GIF format. It will be used only for some bot inline results

thumbnailFormatMpeg4.description: The thumbnail is in MPEG4 format. It will be used only for some animations and videos

thumbnailFormatPng.description: The thumbnail is in PNG format. It will be used only for background patterns

thumbnailFormatTgs.description: The thumbnail is in TGS format. It will be used only for TGS sticker sets

thumbnailFormatWebm.description: The thumbnail is in WEBM format. It will be used only for WEBM sticker sets

thumbnailFormatWebp.description: The thumbnail is in WEBP format. It will be used only for some stickers

thumbnail.description: Represents a thumbnail

maskPointForehead.description: The mask is placed relatively to the forehead

maskPointEyes.description: The mask is placed relatively to the eyes

maskPointMouth.description: The mask is placed relatively to the mouth

maskPointChin.description: The mask is placed relatively to the chin

maskPosition.description: Position on a photo where a mask is placed

point.description: Part of the face, relative to which the mask is placed

x_shift.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. (For example, -1.0 will place the mask just to the left of the default mask position)

y_shift.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. (For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position)

scale.description: Mask scaling coefficient. (For example, 2.0 means a doubled size)

stickerFormatWebp.description: The sticker is an image in WEBP format

stickerFormatTgs.description: The sticker is an animation in TGS format

stickerFormatWebm.description: The sticker is a video in WEBM format

stickerTypeRegular.description: The sticker is a regular sticker

stickerTypeMask.description: The sticker is a mask in WEBP format to be placed on photos or videos

stickerTypeCustomEmoji.description: The sticker is a custom emoji to be used inside message text and caption

stickerFullTypeRegular.description: The sticker is a regular sticker

premium_animation.description: Premium animation of the sticker; may be null. If present, only Telegram Premium users can use the sticker

stickerFullTypeMask.description: The sticker is a mask in WEBP format to be placed on photos or videos

mask_position.description: Position where the mask is placed; may be null

stickerFullTypeCustomEmoji.description: The sticker is a custom emoji to be used inside message text and caption. Currently, only Telegram Premium users can use custom emoji

needs_repainting.description: True, if the sticker must be repainted to a text color in messages, the color of the Telegram Premium badge in emoji status, white color on chat photos, or another appropriate color in other places

closedVectorPath.description: Represents a closed vector path. The path begins at the end point of the last command

pollOption.description: Describes one answer option of a poll

voter_count.description: Number of voters for this option, available only for closed or voted polls

vote_percentage.description: The percentage of votes for this option; 0-100

is_chosen.description: True, if the option was chosen by the user

is_being_chosen.description: True, if the option is being chosen by a pending setPollAnswer request

allow_multiple_answers.description: True, if multiple answer options can be chosen simultaneously

pollTypeQuiz.description: A poll in quiz mode, which has exactly one correct answer option and can be answered only once

correct_option_id.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option; -1 for a yet unanswered poll

explanation.description: Text that is shown when the user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon; 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds; empty for a yet unanswered poll

animation.description: Describes an animation file. The animation must be encoded in GIF or MPEG4 format

duration.description: Duration of the animation, in seconds; as defined by the sender

file_name.description: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender

mime_type.description: MIME type of the file, usually "image/gif" or "video/mp4"

has_stickers.description: True, if stickers were added to the animation. The list of corresponding sticker set can be received using getAttachedStickerSets

thumbnail.description: Animation thumbnail in JPEG or MPEG4 format; may be null

audio.description: Describes an audio file. Audio is usually in MP3 or M4A format

duration.description: Duration of the audio, in seconds; as defined by the sender

title.description: Title of the audio; as defined by the sender

performer.description: Performer of the audio; as defined by the sender

file_name.description: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender

album_cover_minithumbnail.description: The minithumbnail of the album cover; may be null

album_cover_thumbnail.description: The thumbnail of the album cover in JPEG format; as defined by the sender. The full size thumbnail is supposed to be extracted from the downloaded audio file; may be null

external_album_covers.description: Album cover variants to use if the downloaded audio file contains no album cover. Provided thumbnail dimensions are approximate

document.description: Describes a document of any type

file_name.description: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender

mime_type.description: MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender

thumbnail.description: Document thumbnail in JPEG or PNG format (PNG will be used only for background patterns); as defined by the sender; may be null

has_stickers.description: True, if stickers were added to the photo. The list of corresponding sticker sets can be received using getAttachedStickerSets

sizes.description: Available variants of the photo, in different sizes

id.description: Unique sticker identifier within the set; 0 if none

set_id.description: Identifier of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs; 0 if none

width.description: Sticker width; as defined by the sender

height.description: Sticker height; as defined by the sender

outline.description: Sticker's outline represented as a list of closed vector paths; may be empty. The coordinate system origin is in the upper-left corner

thumbnail.description: Sticker thumbnail in WEBP or JPEG format; may be null

duration.description: Duration of the video, in seconds; as defined by the sender

width.description: Video width; as defined by the sender

height.description: Video height; as defined by the sender

file_name.description: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender

mime_type.description: MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender

has_stickers.description: True, if stickers were added to the video. The list of corresponding sticker sets can be received using getAttachedStickerSets

supports_streaming.description: True, if the video is supposed to be streamed

thumbnail.description: Video thumbnail in JPEG or MPEG4 format; as defined by the sender; may be null

videoNote.description: Describes a video note. The video must be equal in width and height, cropped to a circle, and stored in MPEG4 format

duration.description: Duration of the video, in seconds; as defined by the sender

waveform.description: A waveform representation of the video note's audio in 5-bit format; may be empty if unknown

length.description: Video width and height; as defined by the sender

thumbnail.description: Video thumbnail in JPEG format; as defined by the sender; may be null

speech_recognition_result.description: Result of speech recognition in the video note; may be null

voiceNote.description: Describes a voice note. The voice note must be encoded with the Opus codec, and stored inside an OGG container. Voice notes can have only a single audio channel

duration.description: Duration of the voice note, in seconds; as defined by the sender

waveform.description: A waveform representation of the voice note in 5-bit format

mime_type.description: MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender

speech_recognition_result.description: Result of speech recognition in the voice note; may be null

animatedEmoji.description: Describes an animated or custom representation of an emoji

sticker.description: Sticker for the emoji; may be null if yet unknown for a custom emoji. If the sticker is a custom emoji, it can have arbitrary format different from stickerFormatTgs

sticker_width.description: Expected width of the sticker, which can be used if the sticker is null

sticker_height.description: Expected height of the sticker, which can be used if the sticker is null

fitzpatrick_type.description: Emoji modifier fitzpatrick type; 0-6; 0 if none

sound.description: File containing the sound to be played when the sticker is clicked; may be null. The sound is encoded with the Opus codec, and stored inside an OGG container

first_name.description: First name of the user; 1-255 characters in length

vcard.description: Additional data about the user in a form of vCard; 0-2048 bytes in length

user_id.description: Identifier of the user, if known; 0 otherwise

location.description: Describes a location on planet Earth

latitude.description: Latitude of the location in degrees; as defined by the sender

longitude.description: Longitude of the location, in degrees; as defined by the sender

horizontal_accuracy.description: The estimated horizontal accuracy of the location, in meters; as defined by the sender. 0 if unknown

location.description: Venue location; as defined by the sender

title.description: Venue name; as defined by the sender

address.description: Venue address; as defined by the sender

provider.description: Provider of the venue database; as defined by the sender. Currently, only "foursquare" and "gplaces" (Google Places) need to be supported

id.description: Identifier of the venue in the provider database; as defined by the sender

type.description: Type of the venue in the provider database; as defined by the sender

game.description: Describes a game. Use getInternalLink with internalLinkTypeGame to share the game

text.description: Game text, usually containing scoreboards for a game

webApp.description: Describes a Web App. Use getInternalLink with internalLinkTypeWebApp to share the Web App

animation.description: Web App animation; may be null

total_voter_count.description: Total number of voters, participating in the poll

recent_voter_user_ids.description: User identifiers of recent voters, if the poll is non-anonymous

is_anonymous.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

open_period.description: Amount of time the poll will be active after creation, in seconds

close_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will automatically be closed

is_closed.description: True, if the poll is closed

is_default.description: True, if this is one of default backgrounds

is_dark.description: True, if the background is dark and is recommended to be used with dark theme

document.description: Document with the background; may be null. Null only for filled backgrounds

chatBackground.description: Describes a background set for a specific chat

dark_theme_dimming.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

id.description: Photo identifier; 0 for an empty photo. Can be used to find a photo in a list of user profile photos

small.description: A small (160x160) user profile photo. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed

big.description: A big (640x640) user profile photo. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed

minithumbnail.description: User profile photo minithumbnail; may be null

has_animation.description: True, if the photo has animated variant

is_personal.description: True, if the photo is visible only for the current user

chatPhotoInfo.description: Contains basic information about the photo of a chat

small.description: A small (160x160) chat photo variant in JPEG format. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed

big.description: A big (640x640) chat photo variant in JPEG format. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed

minithumbnail.description: Chat photo minithumbnail; may be null

has_animation.description: True, if the photo has animated variant

is_personal.description: True, if the photo is visible only for the current user

userTypeDeleted.description: A deleted user or deleted bot. No information on the user besides the user identifier is available. It is not possible to perform any active actions on this type of user

can_be_edited.description: True, if the bot is owned by the current user and can be edited using the methods toggleBotUsernameIsActive, reorderBotActiveUsernames, setBotProfilePhoto, setBotName, setBotInfoDescription, and setBotInfoShortDescription

can_join_groups.description: True, if the bot can be invited to basic group and supergroup chats

can_read_all_group_messages.description: True, if the bot can read all messages in basic group or supergroup chats and not just those addressed to the bot. In private and channel chats a bot can always read all messages

is_inline.description: True, if the bot supports inline queries

inline_query_placeholder.description: Placeholder for inline queries (displayed on the application input field)

need_location.description: True, if the location of the user is expected to be sent with every inline query to this bot

can_be_added_to_attachment_menu.description: True, if the bot can be added to attachment menu

userTypeUnknown.description: No information on the user besides the user identifier is available, yet this user has not been deleted. This object is extremely rare and must be handled like a deleted user. It is not possible to perform any actions on users of this type

botCommand.description: Represents a command supported by a bot

botCommands.description: Contains a list of bot commands

botMenuButton.description: Describes a button to be shown instead of bot commands menu button

url.description: URL to be passed to openWebApp

chatLocation.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected

address.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

chatPhotoStickerTypeRegularOrMask.description: Information about the sticker, which was used to create the chat photo

sticker_id.description: Identifier of the sticker in the set

chatPhotoStickerTypeCustomEmoji.description: Information about the custom emoji, which was used to create the chat photo

chatPhotoSticker.description: Information about the sticker, which was used to create the chat photo. The sticker is shown at the center of the photo and occupies at most 67% of it

background_fill.description: The fill to be used as background for the sticker; rotation angle in backgroundFillGradient isn't supported

animatedChatPhoto.description: Animated variant of a chat photo in MPEG4 format

main_frame_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the frame, used as a static chat photo

chatPhoto.description: Describes a chat or user profile photo

added_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the photo has been added

sizes.description: Available variants of the photo in JPEG format, in different size

animation.description: A big (up to 1280x1280) animated variant of the photo in MPEG4 format; may be null

small_animation.description: A small (160x160) animated variant of the photo in MPEG4 format; may be null even the big animation is available

sticker.description: Sticker-based version of the chat photo; may be null

chatPhotos.description: Contains a list of chat or user profile photos

total_count.description: Total number of photos

inputChatPhotoPrevious.description: A previously used profile photo of the current user

chat_photo_id.description: Identifier of the current user's profile photo to reuse

inputChatPhotoStatic.description: A static photo in JPEG format

photo.description: Photo to be set as profile photo. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are allowed

inputChatPhotoAnimation.description: An animation in MPEG4 format; must be square, at most 10 seconds long, have width between 160 and 1280 and be at most 2MB in size

animation.description: Animation to be set as profile photo. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are allowed

main_frame_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the frame, which will be used as static chat photo

inputChatPhotoSticker.description: A sticker on a custom background

chatPermissions.description: Describes actions that a user is allowed to take in a chat

can_send_basic_messages.description: True, if the user can send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations, and venues

can_send_audios.description: True, if the user can send music files

can_send_documents.description: True, if the user can send documents

can_send_photos.description: True, if the user can send audio photos

can_send_videos.description: True, if the user can send audio videos

can_send_video_notes.description: True, if the user can send video notes

can_send_voice_notes.description: True, if the user can send voice notes

can_send_polls.description: True, if the user can send polls

can_send_other_messages.description: True, if the user can send animations, games, stickers, and dice and use inline bots

can_add_web_page_previews.description: True, if the user may add a web page preview to their messages

can_change_info.description: True, if the user can change the chat title, photo, and other settings

can_invite_users.description: True, if the user can invite new users to the chat

can_pin_messages.description: True, if the user can pin messages

can_manage_topics.description: True, if the user can manage topics

can_manage_chat.description: True, if the administrator can get chat event log, get chat statistics, get message statistics in channels, get channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other privilege; applicable to supergroups and channels only

can_change_info.description: True, if the administrator can change the chat title, photo, and other settings

can_post_messages.description: True, if the administrator can create channel posts; applicable to channels only

can_edit_messages.description: True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and pin messages; applicable to channels only

can_delete_messages.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

can_invite_users.description: True, if the administrator can invite new users to the chat

can_restrict_members.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban, or unban chat members; always true for channels

can_pin_messages.description: True, if the administrator can pin messages; applicable to basic groups and supergroups only

can_manage_topics.description: True, if the administrator can manage topics; applicable to forum supergroups only

can_promote_members.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that were directly or indirectly promoted by them

can_manage_video_chats.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

is_anonymous.description: True, if the administrator isn't shown in the chat member list and sends messages anonymously; applicable to supergroups only

premiumPaymentOption.description: Describes an option for buying Telegram Premium to a user

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code for Telegram Premium subscription payment

amount.description: The amount to pay, in the smallest units of the currency

discount_percentage.description: The discount associated with this option, as a percentage

month_count.description: Number of month the Telegram Premium subscription will be active

store_product_id.description: Identifier of the store product associated with the option

payment_link.description: An internal link to be opened for buying Telegram Premium to the user if store payment isn't possible; may be null if direct payment isn't available

premiumStatePaymentOption.description: Describes an option for buying or upgrading Telegram Premium for self

is_current.description: True, if this is the currently used Telegram Premium subscription option

is_upgrade.description: True, if the payment option can be used to upgrade the existing Telegram Premium subscription

last_transaction_id.description: Identifier of the last in-store transaction for the currently used option

emojiStatus.description: Describes a custom emoji to be shown instead of the Telegram Premium badge

custom_emoji_id.description: Identifier of the custom emoji in stickerFormatTgs format

emojiStatuses.description: Contains a list of emoji statuses

usernames.description: Describes usernames assigned to a user, a supergroup, or a channel

active_usernames.description: List of active usernames; the first one must be shown as the primary username. The order of active usernames can be changed with reorderActiveUsernames, reorderBotActiveUsernames or reorderSupergroupActiveUsernames

disabled_usernames.description: List of currently disabled usernames; the username can be activated with toggleUsernameIsActive, toggleBotUsernameIsActive, or toggleSupergroupUsernameIsActive

editable_username.description: The active username, which can be changed with setUsername or setSupergroupUsername

usernames.description: Usernames of the user; may be null

status.description: Current online status of the user

profile_photo.description: Profile photo of the user; may be null

emoji_status.description: Emoji status to be shown instead of the default Telegram Premium badge; may be null. For Telegram Premium users only

is_contact.description: The user is a contact of the current user

is_mutual_contact.description: The user is a contact of the current user and the current user is a contact of the user

is_verified.description: True, if the user is verified

is_premium.description: True, if the user is a Telegram Premium user

is_support.description: True, if the user is Telegram support account

restriction_reason.description: If non-empty, it contains a human-readable description of the reason why access to this user must be restricted

is_scam.description: True, if many users reported this user as a scam

is_fake.description: True, if many users reported this user as a fake account

have_access.description: If false, the user is inaccessible, and the only information known about the user is inside this class. Identifier of the user can't be passed to any method

language_code.description: IETF language tag of the user's language; only available to bots

added_to_attachment_menu.description: True, if the user added the current bot to attachment menu; only available to bots

short_description.description: The text that is shown on the bot's profile page and is sent together with the link when users share the bot

description.description: The text shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty

photo.description: Photo shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty; may be null

animation.description: Animation shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty; may be null

menu_button.description: Information about a button to show instead of the bot commands menu button; may be null if ordinary bot commands menu must be shown

default_group_administrator_rights.description: Default administrator rights for adding the bot to basic group and supergroup chats; may be null

default_channel_administrator_rights.description: Default administrator rights for adding the bot to channels; may be null

edit_commands_link.description: The internal link, which can be used to edit bot commands; may be null

edit_description_link.description: The internal link, which can be used to edit bot description; may be null

edit_description_media_link.description: The internal link, which can be used to edit the photo or animation shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty; may be null

edit_settings_link.description: The internal link, which can be used to edit bot settings; may be null

userFullInfo.description: Contains full information about a user

personal_photo.description: User profile photo set by the current user for the contact; may be null. If null and user.profile_photo is null, then the photo is empty; otherwise, it is unknown. If non-null, then it is the same photo as in user.profile_photo and chat.photo. This photo isn't returned in the list of user photos

photo.description: User profile photo; may be null. If null and user.profile_photo is null, then the photo is empty; otherwise, it is unknown. If non-null and personal_photo is null, then it is the same photo as in user.profile_photo and chat.photo

public_photo.description: User profile photo visible if the main photo is hidden by privacy settings; may be null. If null and user.profile_photo is null, then the photo is empty; otherwise, it is unknown. If non-null and both photo and personal_photo are null, then it is the same photo as in user.profile_photo and chat.photo. This photo isn't returned in the list of user photos

is_blocked.description: True, if the user is blocked by the current user

can_be_called.description: True, if the user can be called

supports_video_calls.description: True, if a video call can be created with the user

has_private_calls.description: True, if the user can't be called due to their privacy settings

has_private_forwards.description: True, if the user can't be linked in forwarded messages due to their privacy settings

has_restricted_voice_and_video_note_mess.description: True, if voice and video notes can't be sent or forwarded to the user

need_phone_number_privacy_exception.description: True, if the current user needs to explicitly allow to share their phone number with the user when the method addContact is used

bio.description: A short user bio; may be null for bots

premium_gift_options.description: The list of available options for gifting Telegram Premium to the user

group_in_common_count.description: Number of group chats where both the other user and the current user are a member; 0 for the current user

bot_info.description: For bots, information about the bot; may be null

total_count.description: Approximate total number of users found

chatAdministrator.description: Contains information about a chat administrator

is_owner.description: True, if the user is the owner of the chat

chatAdministrators.description: Represents a list of chat administrators

chatMemberStatusCreator.description: The user is the owner of the chat and has all the administrator privileges

custom_title.description: A custom title of the owner; 0-16 characters without emojis; applicable to supergroups only

is_anonymous.description: True, if the creator isn't shown in the chat member list and sends messages anonymously; applicable to supergroups only

is_member.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat

chatMemberStatusAdministrator.description: The user is a member of the chat and has some additional privileges. In basic groups, administrators can edit and delete messages sent by others, add new members, ban unprivileged members, and manage video chats. In supergroups and channels, there are more detailed options for administrator privileges

custom_title.description: A custom title of the administrator; 0-16 characters without emojis; applicable to supergroups only

can_be_edited.description: True, if the current user can edit the administrator privileges for the called user

chatMemberStatusMember.description: The user is a member of the chat, without any additional privileges or restrictions

chatMemberStatusRestricted.description: The user is under certain restrictions in the chat. Not supported in basic groups and channels

is_member.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat

restricted_until_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when restrictions will be lifted from the user; 0 if never. If the user is restricted for more than 366 days or for less than 30 seconds from the current time, the user is considered to be restricted forever

chatMemberStatusLeft.description: The user or the chat is not a chat member

chatMemberStatusBanned.description: The user or the chat was banned (and hence is not a member of the chat). Implies the user can't return to the chat, view messages, or be used as a participant identifier to join a video chat of the chat

banned_until_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user will be unbanned; 0 if never. If the user is banned for more than 366 days or for less than 30 seconds from the current time, the user is considered to be banned forever. Always 0 in basic groups

chatMember.description: Describes a user or a chat as a member of another chat

member_id.description: Identifier of the chat member. Currently, other chats can be only Left or Banned. Only supergroups and channels can have other chats as Left or Banned members and these chats must be supergroups or channels

inviter_user_id.description: Identifier of a user that invited/promoted/banned this member in the chat; 0 if unknown

joined_chat_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user joined/was promoted/was banned in the chat

status.description: Status of the member in the chat

chatMembers.description: Contains a list of chat members

total_count.description: Approximate total number of chat members found

chatMembersFilterMembers.description: Returns all chat members, including restricted chat members

chatMembersFilterMention.description: Returns users which can be mentioned in the chat

message_thread_id.description: If non-zero, the identifier of the current message thread

chatMembersFilterRestricted.description: Returns users under certain restrictions in the chat; can be used only by administrators in a supergroup

chatMembersFilterBanned.description: Returns users banned from the chat; can be used only by administrators in a supergroup or in a channel

chatMembersFilterBots.description: Returns bot members of the chat

supergroupMembersFilterRecent.description: Returns recently active users in reverse chronological order

supergroupMembersFilterContacts.description: Returns contacts of the user, which are members of the supergroup or channel

supergroupMembersFilterSearch.description: Used to search for supergroup or channel members via a (string) query

supergroupMembersFilterRestricted.description: Returns restricted supergroup members; can be used only by administrators

supergroupMembersFilterBanned.description: Returns users banned from the supergroup or channel; can be used only by administrators

supergroupMembersFilterMention.description: Returns users which can be mentioned in the supergroup

message_thread_id.description: If non-zero, the identifier of the current message thread

supergroupMembersFilterBots.description: Returns bot members of the supergroup or channel

creator_user_id.description: User identifier of an administrator created the link

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link was created

edit_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link was last edited; 0 if never or unknown

expiration_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire; 0 if never

member_limit.description: The maximum number of members, which can join the chat using the link simultaneously; 0 if not limited. Always 0 if the link requires approval

member_count.description: Number of chat members, which joined the chat using the link

pending_join_request_count.description: Number of pending join requests created using this link

creates_join_request.description: True, if the link only creates join request. If true, total number of joining members will be unlimited

is_primary.description: True, if the link is primary. Primary invite link can't have name, expiration date, or usage limit. There is exactly one primary invite link for each administrator with can_invite_users right at a given time

is_revoked.description: True, if the link was revoked

chatInviteLinks.description: Contains a list of chat invite links

total_count.description: Approximate total number of chat invite links found

chatInviteLinkCount.description: Describes a chat administrator with a number of active and revoked chat invite links

chatInviteLinkCounts.description: Contains a list of chat invite link counts

chatInviteLinkMember.description: Describes a chat member joined a chat via an invite link

joined_chat_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user joined the chat

via_chat_folder_invite_link.description: True, if the user has joined the chat using an invite link for a chat folder

approver_user_id.description: User identifier of the chat administrator, approved user join request

chatInviteLinkMembers.description: Contains a list of chat members joined a chat via an invite link

total_count.description: Approximate total number of chat members found

members.description: List of chat members, joined a chat via an invite link

chatInviteLinkInfo.description: Contains information about a chat invite link

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the invite link; 0 if the user has no access to the chat before joining

accessible_for.description: If non-zero, the amount of time for which read access to the chat will remain available, in seconds

member_count.description: Number of members in the chat

member_user_ids.description: User identifiers of some chat members that may be known to the current user

creates_join_request.description: True, if the link only creates join request

is_public.description: True, if the chat is a public supergroup or channel, i.e. it has a username or it is a location-based supergroup

chatJoinRequest.description: Describes a user that sent a join request and waits for administrator approval

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user sent the join request

bio.description: A short bio of the user

chatJoinRequests.description: Contains a list of requests to join a chat

total_count.description: Approximate total number of requests found

chatJoinRequestsInfo.description: Contains information about pending join requests for a chat

total_count.description: Total number of pending join requests

user_ids.description: Identifiers of at most 3 users sent the newest pending join requests

basicGroup.description: Represents a basic group of 0-200 users (must be upgraded to a supergroup to accommodate more than 200 users)

member_count.description: Number of members in the group

status.description: Status of the current user in the group

is_active.description: True, if the group is active

upgraded_to_supergroup_id.description: Identifier of the supergroup to which this group was upgraded; 0 if none

basicGroupFullInfo.description: Contains full information about a basic group

photo.description: Chat photo; may be null if empty or unknown. If non-null, then it is the same photo as in chat.photo

description.description: Group description. Updated only after the basic group is opened

creator_user_id.description: User identifier of the creator of the group; 0 if unknown

can_hide_members.description: True, if non-administrators and non-bots can be hidden in responses to getSupergroupMembers and searchChatMembers for non-administrators after upgrading the basic group to a supergroup

can_toggle_aggressive_anti_spam.description: True, if aggressive anti-spam checks can be enabled or disabled in the supergroup after upgrading the basic group to a supergroup

invite_link.description: Primary invite link for this group; may be null. For chat administrators with can_invite_users right only. Updated only after the basic group is opened

bot_commands.description: List of commands of bots in the group

supergroup.description: Represents a supergroup or channel with zero or more members (subscribers in the case of channels). From the point of view of the system, a channel is a special kind of a supergroup: only administrators can post and see the list of members, and posts from all administrators use the name and photo of the channel instead of individual names and profile photos. Unlike supergroups, channels can have an unlimited number of subscribers

usernames.description: Usernames of the supergroup or channel; may be null

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the current user joined, or the point in time when the supergroup or channel was created, in case the user is not a member

status.description: Status of the current user in the supergroup or channel; custom title will always be empty

member_count.description: Number of members in the supergroup or channel; 0 if unknown. Currently, it is guaranteed to be known only if the supergroup or channel was received through searchPublicChats, searchChatsNearby, getInactiveSupergroupChats, getSuitableDiscussionChats, getGroupsInCommon, getUserPrivacySettingRules, or in chatFolderInviteLinkInfo.missing_chat_ids

has_linked_chat.description: True, if the channel has a discussion group, or the supergroup is the designated discussion group for a channel

has_location.description: True, if the supergroup is connected to a location, i.e. the supergroup is a location-based supergroup

sign_messages.description: True, if messages sent to the channel need to contain information about the sender. This field is only applicable to channels

join_to_send_messages.description: True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages. Always true for channels and non-discussion supergroups

join_by_request.description: True, if all users directly joining the supergroup need to be approved by supergroup administrators. Always false for channels and supergroups without username, location, or a linked chat

is_slow_mode_enabled.description: True, if the slow mode is enabled in the supergroup

is_channel.description: True, if the supergroup is a channel

is_broadcast_group.description: True, if the supergroup is a broadcast group, i.e. only administrators can send messages and there is no limit on the number of members

is_forum.description: True, if the supergroup must be shown as a forum by default

is_verified.description: True, if the supergroup or channel is verified

restriction_reason.description: If non-empty, contains a human-readable description of the reason why access to this supergroup or channel must be restricted

is_scam.description: True, if many users reported this supergroup or channel as a scam

is_fake.description: True, if many users reported this supergroup or channel as a fake account

supergroupFullInfo.description: Contains full information about a supergroup or channel

photo.description: Chat photo; may be null if empty or unknown. If non-null, then it is the same photo as in chat.photo

member_count.description: Number of members in the supergroup or channel; 0 if unknown

administrator_count.description: Number of privileged users in the supergroup or channel; 0 if unknown

restricted_count.description: Number of restricted users in the supergroup; 0 if unknown

banned_count.description: Number of users banned from chat; 0 if unknown

linked_chat_id.description: Chat identifier of a discussion group for the channel, or a channel, for which the supergroup is the designated discussion group; 0 if none or unknown

slow_mode_delay.description: Delay between consecutive sent messages for non-administrator supergroup members, in seconds

slow_mode_delay_expires_in.description: Time left before next message can be sent in the supergroup, in seconds. An updateSupergroupFullInfo update is not triggered when value of this field changes, but both new and old values are non-zero

can_get_members.description: True, if members of the chat can be retrieved via getSupergroupMembers or searchChatMembers

has_hidden_members.description: True, if non-administrators can receive only administrators and bots using getSupergroupMembers or searchChatMembers

can_hide_members.description: True, if non-administrators and non-bots can be hidden in responses to getSupergroupMembers and searchChatMembers for non-administrators

can_set_username.description: True, if the chat username can be changed

can_set_sticker_set.description: True, if the supergroup sticker set can be changed

can_set_location.description: True, if the supergroup location can be changed

can_get_statistics.description: True, if the supergroup or channel statistics are available

can_toggle_aggressive_anti_spam.description: True, if aggressive anti-spam checks can be enabled or disabled in the supergroup

is_all_history_available.description: True, if new chat members will have access to old messages. In public, discussion, of forum groups and all channels, old messages are always available, so this option affects only private non-forum supergroups without a linked chat. The value of this field is only available to chat administrators

has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled.description: True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The value of this field is only available to chat administrators

sticker_set_id.description: Identifier of the supergroup sticker set; 0 if none

location.description: Location to which the supergroup is connected; may be null

invite_link.description: Primary invite link for the chat; may be null. For chat administrators with can_invite_users right only

bot_commands.description: List of commands of bots in the group

upgraded_from_basic_group_id.description: Identifier of the basic group from which supergroup was upgraded; 0 if none

upgraded_from_max_message_id.description: Identifier of the last message in the basic group from which supergroup was upgraded; 0 if none

secretChatStatePending.description: The secret chat is not yet created; waiting for the other user to get online

secretChatStateReady.description: The secret chat is ready to use

is_outbound.description: True, if the chat was created by the current user; false otherwise

key_hash.description: Hash of the currently used key for comparison with the hash of the chat partner's key. This is a string of 36 little-endian bytes, which must be split into groups of 2 bits, each denoting a pixel of one of 4 colors FFFFFF, D5E6F3, 2D5775, and 2F99C9. The pixels must be used to make a 12x12 square image filled from left to right, top to bottom. Alternatively, the first 32 bytes of the hash can be converted to the hexadecimal format and printed as 32 2-digit hex numbers

layer.description: Secret chat layer; determines features supported by the chat partner's application. Nested text entities and underline and strikethrough entities are supported if the layer >= 101, files bigger than 2000MB are supported if the layer >= 143, spoiler and custom emoji text entities are supported if the layer >= 144

messageSenderUser.description: The message was sent by a known user

user_id.description: Identifier of the user that sent the message

messageSenderChat.description: The message was sent on behalf of a chat

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat that sent the message

messageSenders.description: Represents a list of message senders

total_count.description: Approximate total number of messages senders found

chatMessageSender.description: Represents a message sender, which can be used to send messages in a chat

needs_premium.description: True, if Telegram Premium is needed to use the message sender

chatMessageSenders.description: Represents a list of message senders, which can be used to send messages in a chat

messageViewer.description: Represents a viewer of a message

view_date.description: Approximate point in time (Unix timestamp) when the message was viewed

messageViewers.description: Represents a list of message viewers

messageForwardOriginUser.description: The message was originally sent by a known user

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user that originally sent the message

messageForwardOriginChat.description: The message was originally sent on behalf of a chat

sender_chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat that originally sent the message

author_signature.description: For messages originally sent by an anonymous chat administrator, original message author signature

messageForwardOriginHiddenUser.description: The message was originally sent by a user, which is hidden by their privacy settings

messageForwardOriginChannel.description: The message was originally a post in a channel

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat from which the message was originally forwarded

message_id.description: Message identifier of the original message

messageForwardOriginMessageImport.description: The message was imported from an exported message history

reactionTypeCustomEmoji.description: A reaction with a custom emoji

custom_emoji_id.description: Unique identifier of the custom emoji

messageForwardInfo.description: Contains information about a forwarded message

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the message was originally sent

public_service_announcement_type.description: The type of a public service announcement for the forwarded message

from_chat_id.description: For messages forwarded to the chat with the current user (Saved Messages), to the Replies bot chat, or to the channel's discussion group, the identifier of the chat from which the message was forwarded last time; 0 if unknown

from_message_id.description: For messages forwarded to the chat with the current user (Saved Messages), to the Replies bot chat, or to the channel's discussion group, the identifier of the original message from which the new message was forwarded last time; 0 if unknown

messageReplyInfo.description: Contains information about replies to a message

reply_count.description: Number of times the message was directly or indirectly replied

recent_replier_ids.description: Identifiers of at most 3 recent repliers to the message; available in channels with a discussion supergroup. The users and chats are expected to be inaccessible: only their photo and name will be available

last_read_inbox_message_id.description: Identifier of the last read incoming reply to the message

last_read_outbox_message_id.description: Identifier of the last read outgoing reply to the message

last_message_id.description: Identifier of the last reply to the message

messageReaction.description: Contains information about a reaction to a message

total_count.description: Number of times the reaction was added

is_chosen.description: True, if the reaction is chosen by the current user

recent_sender_ids.description: Identifiers of at most 3 recent message senders, added the reaction; available in private, basic group and supergroup chats

messageInteractionInfo.description: Contains information about interactions with a message

view_count.description: Number of times the message was viewed

forward_count.description: Number of times the message was forwarded

reply_info.description: Information about direct or indirect replies to the message; may be null. Currently, available only in channels with a discussion supergroup and discussion supergroups for messages, which are not replies itself

reactions.description: The list of reactions added to the message

unreadReaction.description: Contains information about an unread reaction to a message

targetChatChosen.description: The chat needs to be chosen by the user among chats of the specified types

allow_user_chats.description: True, if private chats with ordinary users are allowed

allow_bot_chats.description: True, if private chats with other bots are allowed

allow_group_chats.description: True, if basic group and supergroup chats are allowed

allow_channel_chats.description: True, if channel chats are allowed

targetChatInternalLink.description: The chat needs to be open with the provided internal link

link.description: An internal link pointing to the chat

internalLinkTypeActiveSessions.description: The link is a link to the active sessions section of the application. Use getActiveSessions to handle the link

internalLinkTypeAttachmentMenuBot.description: The link is a link to an attachment menu bot to be opened in the specified or a chosen chat. Process given target_chat to open the chat. Then, call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot and can be added to attachment menu. Then, use getAttachmentMenuBot to receive information about the bot. If the bot isn't added to attachment menu, then user needs to confirm adding the bot to attachment menu. If user confirms adding, then use toggleBotIsAddedToAttachmentMenu to add it. If the attachment menu bot can't be used in the opened chat, show an error to the user. If the bot is added to attachment menu and can be used in the chat, then use openWebApp with the given URL

url.description: URL to be passed to openWebApp

internalLinkTypeAuthenticationCode.description: The link contains an authentication code. Call checkAuthenticationCode with the code if the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode

internalLinkTypeBackground.description: The link is a link to a background. Call searchBackground with the given background name to process the link

internalLinkTypeBotAddToChannel.description: The link is a link to a Telegram bot, which is supposed to be added to a channel chat as an administrator. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username and check that the user is a bot, ask the current user to select a channel chat to add the bot to as an administrator. Then, call getChatMember to receive the current bot rights in the chat and if the bot already is an administrator, check that the current user can edit its administrator rights and combine received rights with the requested administrator rights. Then, show confirmation box to the user, and call setChatMemberStatus with the chosen chat and confirmed rights

administrator_rights.description: Expected administrator rights for the bot

internalLinkTypeBotStart.description: The link is a link to a chat with a Telegram bot. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot, show START button in the chat with the bot, and then call sendBotStartMessage with the given start parameter after the button is pressed

start_parameter.description: The parameter to be passed to sendBotStartMessage

autostart.description: True, if sendBotStartMessage must be called automatically without showing the START button

internalLinkTypeBotStartInGroup.description: The link is a link to a Telegram bot, which is supposed to be added to a group chat. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot and can be added to groups, ask the current user to select a basic group or a supergroup chat to add the bot to, taking into account that bots can be added to a public supergroup only by administrators of the supergroup. If administrator rights are provided by the link, call getChatMember to receive the current bot rights in the chat and if the bot already is an administrator, check that the current user can edit its administrator rights, combine received rights with the requested administrator rights, show confirmation box to the user, and call setChatMemberStatus with the chosen chat and confirmed administrator rights. Before call to setChatMemberStatus it may be required to upgrade the chosen basic group chat to a supergroup chat. Then, if start_parameter isn't empty, call sendBotStartMessage with the given start parameter and the chosen chat; otherwise, just send /start message with bot's username added to the chat.

start_parameter.description: The parameter to be passed to sendBotStartMessage

administrator_rights.description: Expected administrator rights for the bot; may be null

internalLinkTypeChangePhoneNumber.description: The link is a link to the change phone number section of the app

internalLinkTypeChatFolderInvite.description: The link is an invite link to a chat folder. Call checkChatFolderInviteLink with the given invite link to process the link

invite_link.description: Internal representation of the invite link

internalLinkTypeChatFolderSettings.description: The link is a link to the folder section of the app settings

internalLinkTypeChatInvite.description: The link is a chat invite link. Call checkChatInviteLink with the given invite link to process the link

invite_link.description: Internal representation of the invite link

internalLinkTypeDefaultMessageAutoDelete.description: The link is a link to the default message auto-delete timer settings section of the app settings

internalLinkTypeEditProfileSettings.description: The link is a link to the edit profile section of the app settings

internalLinkTypeGame.description: The link is a link to a game. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot, ask the current user to select a chat to send the game, and then call sendMessage with inputMessageGame

bot_username.description: Username of the bot that owns the game

internalLinkTypeInstantView.description: The link must be opened in an Instant View. Call getWebPageInstantView with the given URL to process the link

url.description: URL to be passed to getWebPageInstantView

fallback_url.description: An URL to open if getWebPageInstantView fails

internalLinkTypeInvoice.description: The link is a link to an invoice. Call getPaymentForm with the given invoice name to process the link

internalLinkTypeLanguagePack.description: The link is a link to a language pack. Call getLanguagePackInfo with the given language pack identifier to process the link

internalLinkTypeLanguageSettings.description: The link is a link to the language section of the app settings

internalLinkTypeMessage.description: The link is a link to a Telegram message or a forum topic. Call getMessageLinkInfo with the given URL to process the link

url.description: URL to be passed to getMessageLinkInfo

internalLinkTypeMessageDraft.description: The link contains a message draft text. A share screen needs to be shown to the user, then the chosen chat must be opened and the text is added to the input field

contains_link.description: True, if the first line of the text contains a link. If true, the input field needs to be focused and the text after the link must be selected

internalLinkTypePassportDataRequest.description: The link contains a request of Telegram passport data. Call getPassportAuthorizationForm with the given parameters to process the link if the link was received from outside of the application; otherwise, ignore it

bot_user_id.description: User identifier of the service's bot

scope.description: Telegram Passport element types requested by the service

nonce.description: Unique request identifier provided by the service

callback_url.description: An HTTP URL to open once the request is finished, canceled, or failed with the parameters tg_passport=success, tg_passport=cancel, or tg_passport=error&error=... respectively. If empty, then onActivityResult method must be used to return response on Android, or the link tgbot{bot_user_id}://passport/success or tgbot{bot_user_id}://passport/cancel must be opened otherwise

internalLinkTypePhoneNumberConfirmation.description: The link can be used to confirm ownership of a phone number to prevent account deletion. Call sendPhoneNumberConfirmationCode with the given hash and phone number to process the link

phone_number.description: Phone number value from the link

internalLinkTypePremiumFeatures.description: The link is a link to the Premium features screen of the application from which the user can subscribe to Telegram Premium. Call getPremiumFeatures with the given referrer to process the link

internalLinkTypePrivacyAndSecuritySettin.description: The link is a link to the privacy and security section of the app settings

internalLinkTypeProxy.description: The link is a link to a proxy. Call addProxy with the given parameters to process the link and add the proxy

internalLinkTypePublicChat.description: The link is a link to a chat by its username. Call searchPublicChat with the given chat username to process the link

internalLinkTypeQrCodeAuthentication.description: The link can be used to login the current user on another device, but it must be scanned from QR-code using in-app camera. An alert similar to "This code can be used to allow someone to log in to your Telegram account. To confirm Telegram login, please go to Settings > Devices > Scan QR and scan the code" needs to be shown

internalLinkTypeRestorePurchases.description: The link forces restore of App Store purchases when opened. For official iOS application only

internalLinkTypeSettings.description: The link is a link to application settings

internalLinkTypeUnsupportedProxy.description: The link is a link to an unsupported proxy. An alert can be shown to the user

redirect_stderr.description: Pass true to additionally redirect stderr to the log file. Ignored on Windows

logVerbosityLevel.description: Contains a TDLib internal log verbosity level

logTags.description: Contains a list of available TDLib internal log tags

userSupportInfo.description: Contains custom information about the user

testInt.description: A simple object containing a number; for testing only

testString.description: A simple object containing a string; for testing only

testBytes.description: A simple object containing a sequence of bytes; for testing only

testVectorInt.description: A simple object containing a vector of numbers; for testing only

testVectorIntObject.description: A simple object containing a vector of objects that hold a number; for testing only

testVectorString.description: A simple object containing a vector of strings; for testing only

testVectorStringObject.description: A simple object containing a vector of objects that hold a string; for testing only

updateAuthorizationState.description: The user authorization state has changed

updateNewMessage.description: A new message was received; can also be an outgoing message

updateMessageSendAcknowledged.description: A request to send a message has reached the Telegram server. This doesn't mean that the message will be sent successfully or even that the send message request will be processed. This update will be sent only if the option "use_quick_ack" is set to true. This update may be sent multiple times for the same message

chat_id.description: The chat identifier of the sent message

updateMessageSendSucceeded.description: A message has been successfully sent

message.description: The sent message. Usually only the message identifier, date, and content are changed, but almost all other fields can also change

updateMessageSendFailed.description: A message failed to send. Be aware that some messages being sent can be irrecoverably deleted, in which case updateDeleteMessages will be received instead of this update

updateMessageEdited.description: A message was edited. Changes in the message content will come in a separate updateMessageContent

edit_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the message was edited

reply_markup.description: New message reply markup; may be null

updateMessageIsPinned.description: The message pinned state was changed

is_pinned.description: True, if the message is pinned

updateMessageInteractionInfo.description: The information about interactions with a message has changed

interaction_info.description: New information about interactions with the message; may be null

updateMessageContentOpened.description: The message content was opened. Updates voice note messages to "listened", video note messages to "viewed" and starts the self-destruct timer

updateMessageMentionRead.description: A message with an unread mention was read

unread_mention_count.description: The new number of unread mention messages left in the chat

updateMessageUnreadReactions.description: The list of unread reactions added to a message was changed

unread_reactions.description: The new list of unread reactions

unread_reaction_count.description: The new number of messages with unread reactions left in the chat

updateMessageLiveLocationViewed.description: A message with a live location was viewed. When the update is received, the application is supposed to update the live location

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat with the live location message

message_id.description: Identifier of the message with live location

updateNewChat.description: A new chat has been loaded/created. This update is guaranteed to come before the chat identifier is returned to the application. The chat field changes will be reported through separate updates

updateChatTitle.description: The title of a chat was changed

photo.description: The new chat photo; may be null

updateChatLastMessage.description: The last message of a chat was changed. If last_message is null, then the last message in the chat became unknown. Some new unknown messages might be added to the chat in this case

last_message.description: The new last message in the chat; may be null

positions.description: The new chat positions in the chat lists

updateChatPosition.description: The position of a chat in a chat list has changed. An updateChatLastMessage or updateChatDraftMessage update might be sent instead of the update

position.description: New chat position. If new order is 0, then the chat needs to be removed from the list

updateChatReadInbox.description: Incoming messages were read or the number of unread messages has been changed

last_read_inbox_message_id.description: Identifier of the last read incoming message

unread_count.description: The number of unread messages left in the chat

last_read_outbox_message_id.description: Identifier of last read outgoing message

updateChatActionBar.description: The chat action bar was changed

action_bar.description: The new value of the action bar; may be null

updateChatAvailableReactions.description: The chat available reactions were changed

available_reactions.description: The new reactions, available in the chat

updateChatDraftMessage.description: A chat draft has changed. Be aware that the update may come in the currently opened chat but with old content of the draft. If the user has changed the content of the draft, this update mustn't be applied

draft_message.description: The new draft message; may be null

positions.description: The new chat positions in the chat lists

updateChatMessageSender.description: The message sender that is selected to send messages in a chat has changed

message_sender_id.description: New value of message_sender_id; may be null if the user can't change message sender

updateChatMessageAutoDeleteTime.description: The message auto-delete or self-destruct timer setting for a chat was changed

updateChatNotificationSettings.description: Notification settings for a chat were changed

updateChatPendingJoinRequests.description: The chat pending join requests were changed

pending_join_requests.description: The new data about pending join requests; may be null

updateChatReplyMarkup.description: The default chat reply markup was changed. Can occur because new messages with reply markup were received or because an old reply markup was hidden by the user

reply_markup_message_id.description: Identifier of the message from which reply markup needs to be used; 0 if there is no default custom reply markup in the chat

background.description: The new chat background; may be null if background was reset to default

theme_name.description: The new name of the chat theme; may be empty if theme was reset to default

unread_mention_count.description: The number of unread mention messages left in the chat

unread_reaction_count.description: The number of messages with unread reactions left in the chat

updateChatVideoChat.description: A chat video chat state has changed

updateChatDefaultDisableNotification.description: The value of the default disable_notification parameter, used when a message is sent to the chat, was changed

updateChatHasProtectedContent.description: A chat content was allowed or restricted for saving

updateChatIsTranslatable.description: Translation of chat messages was enabled or disabled

updateChatIsMarkedAsUnread.description: A chat was marked as unread or was read

updateChatIsBlocked.description: A chat was blocked or unblocked

updateChatHasScheduledMessages.description: A chat's has_scheduled_messages field has changed

updateChatFolders.description: The list of chat folders or a chat folder has changed

chat_folders.description: The new list of chat folders

main_chat_list_position.description: Position of the main chat list among chat folders, 0-based
